title: 2024 PORSCHE 911 (992) DAKAR - 46KM - VAT Q
description:
KEY FACTS

This 992-generation Porsche 911 Dakar is an acclaimed all-terrain performance car, finished in the evocative ‘Roughroads’ colour scheme. It is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.0-litre flat-six, delivering 480PS and 570Nm of torque to all four wheels through an eight-speed automatic transmission with paddle shift. The odometer shows just 46 kilometres from new.

Please note: this is a VAT-qualifying / tax-deductible vehicle for those who are able to reclaim it. This means that the ‘hammer price’ includes VAT, and the winning bidder will be provided with a VAT invoice.

For Spanish buyers: an additional 16% would be due on top of the hammer price to register the vehicle.

EQUIPMENT AND FEATURES

As standard, the 992 Dakar features a raft of technology including Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus), Porsche Traction Management, Sport Chrono Package with Dakar-specific engine mounts and ‘Offroad’ and ‘Rallye’ modes, Power Steering Plus, Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC), and rear-axle steering. The front and rear bumpers both feature stainless-steel protection guards, and the car also features a lightweight carbon-fibre bonnet, a fixed CFRP rear spoiler, an Exclusive Design fuel filler cap, and black wheel arch mouldings. This example is finished in the ‘Roughroads’ livery as a nod to the original ‘Rothmans’-sponsored cars, and features a metallic blue lower section and a white upper section complete with gold and red bands. The cabin is trimmed in black leather and Race-Tex, punctuated by blue stitching and embroidered headrests. It rides on a set of white 19-inch front and 20-inch rear five-spoke alloy wheels, fitted with Pirelli Scorpion All-Terrain tyres. Equipment includes parking assistance with cameras, carbon-fibre bucket seats, a half roll cage, suspension lift, cruise control, dual-zone climate control, Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with satellite navigation, Apple CarPlay, and Android Auto, and a roof rack with integrated LED lights, jerry cans, and traction boards. Accompanying the sale is the memento box including numbered plaque and limited-edition watch, fire extinguisher, warning triangle, gloves, straps, and two keys.

Specification:

  • High-gloss black brake callipers
  • Air purification ioniser
  • Lightweight construction and noise protection glazing (including privacy glass)
  • Leather steering column
  • Bi-colour Rallye Design Package
  • Rally package with fire extinguisher
  • Smoker’s package
  • Race-Tex sunshades
  • Burmester surround-sound system
  • Vehicle Tracking System Plus
  • Coloured rev counter
  • Roof rack with LED auxiliary lights and complete set of accessories (water canisters, folding shovels, and traction boards)
  • Dakar watch

CONDITION

Please refer to the photo gallery to assess exterior and interior condition.

SUMMARY

The 992-generation Porsche 911 Dakar was released in celebration of the 1984 Paris Dakar-conquering 911 Carrera, and features a raft of upgrades including raised suspension and a new driving mode. This example is presented with the attention-grabbing ‘Roughroads’ livery in tribute to the original ‘Rothmans’ colour scheme, and was specified with the purposeful roof rack and accessory kit. Also supplied with several extras including the individually numbered Porsche Design watch, it would make a fantastic addition to a collection of Stuttgart’s finest and a thrilling companion for high-adrenaline weekend blasts, both on and off road.

The description of this consignment is, to the best of the seller’s knowledge, accurate and not misleading. Collecting Cars requests a range of detail about the lot from the seller and performs a level of due diligence. However, potential buyers must independently satisfy themselves as to the accuracy of the description. Potential buyers should view or arrange inspections as well as conduct any research they feel is necessary before committing to bid or buy.

Please note that it is not uncommon for classic or collectible vehicles to have received cosmetic repairs in the past, either to rectify damage or refresh appearance, and this work may be undetectable even upon visual inspection. Unless there is an explicit statement by the seller to the contrary, please assume that any vehicle could have had bodywork or paintwork during its life. Furthermore, photographs may not reflect the true colour or full condition of the vehicle. It is a bidder’s responsibility to satisfy themselves of the colour and condition of a vehicle, including its interior and the existence of any remedial bodywork or paintwork, before committing to bid or buy. This includes by raising enquiries with the seller in the comments section.

For vehicles, unless otherwise stated, potential buyers should also assume that any cherished registration may be retained by the seller. Please see our Terms and Conditions for full details.
